titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the George B. Barbour papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Lyalya Kharitonova

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-04-19T15:25-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 2 manuscript boxes, 1 envelope, 1 motion picture film reel

did.abstract: Correspondence, photographs, post cards, drawings, and a film relating to political and social conditions in China, missionary service in China, and university education in China.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], George B. Barbour papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1973.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: George B. Barbour was an American geologist, missionary, and educator in China from 1920 to 1932.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, photographs, post cards, drawings, and a film relating to political and social conditions in China, missionary service in China, and university education in China.

did.unittitle: "Introduction to a collection of family letters concerning missionary work in China,"
Family letters concerning missionary work in China,
Family letters concerning missionary work in China,
5 photos, 27 drawings; and 4 postcards of scenic and cultural sites in China. Includes photo of trackers path along the Yangtze Gorge and one photo of Barbour family members,
Motion picture film relating to political and social conditions in China,
